name: Tonkatsu
description: Tonkatsu is a Japanese dish of a deep-fried pork cutlet coated with panko breadcrumbs. It's often served with shredded cabbage and tonkatsu sauce.
steps: Place the pork chops between two pieces of plastic wrap and gently pound them with a meat mallet or rolling pin until they are about ½ inch thick.
Dredge each pork chop in flour, ensuring it is fully coated. Dip into the beaten egg, letting the excess drip off. Finally, coat with panko breadcrumbs, pressing lightly so the crumbs stick well.
Heat about 1 inch of oil in a frying pan over medium heat (around 350°F or 175°C). Carefully place the breaded pork in the hot oil and fry for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Remove and place on a wire rack or paper towels to drain excess oil.
Slice into strips and serve with tonkatsu sauce, shredded cabbage, and steamed rice.
tips: Moisten the panko: Spray water on dried panko to add moisture.
Make slits in connective tissue: This helps the tonkatsu stay flat.
Pound the meat: Improves texture and tenderness.

name: Braised Lamb Shank
description: Tender and flavorful lamb shank slow-cooked in a rich, aromatic sauce.
steps: Preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C).
Season the lamb shanks with salt and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Sear the lamb shanks until browned on all sides, then remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add crushed tomatoes, beef broth, and red wine.
Return the lamb shanks to the pot, add rosemary, thyme, and bay leaf, and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and transfer it to the preheated oven. Braise for 2 to 2.5 hours until the lamb is tender and falling off the bone.
Remove from the oven and let rest for a few minutes before serving. Discard herbs and bay leaf.
tips: For extra depth of flavor, marinate the lamb shanks overnight in red wine and herbs.
Serve with mashed potatoes or polenta to soak up the rich sauce.
If the sauce is too thin, simmer it on the stove for a few minutes after removing the lamb.

name: Arepa de queso
ingredients: 2 cups pre-cooked white cornmeal (such as P.A.N.®)
steps: Shred 3 ounces of the mozzarella and cut remaining 5 ounces into 1/2-inch cubes. Transfer shredded cheese to a large bowl and cubed cheese to a medium bowl.
Add cornmeal, 1 teaspoon salt, and warm water to the shredded cheese and mix to combine. Set aside for 10 minutes to allow cornmeal to absorb liquid. The mixture should resemble soft Play-Doh.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).

With damp palms and fingers, place 1/4 cup arepa mixture into your palm and flatten into a 2 1/2-inch disk. Place 3 to 4 cubes of the mozzarella into the center. Gently fold edges of dough over to cover mozzarella cubes completely, patting to form a cake. Repeat until all dough and cheese has been used.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add 3 or 4 arepas and cook until both sides are golden brown and charred in spots, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Remove to a parchment-lined baking sheet and season with a pinch of the remaining salt. Place in the preheated oven to keep warm. Repeat with remaining oil, arepas, and salt.
tips: Use high-quality basmati rice for best results.
Saffron can be added for enhanced flavor and color.
Ghee can be used instead of oil for a richer taste.

name: Lomo Saltado
description: A Peruvian stir-fry combining marinated strips of sirloin, onions, tomatoes, and french fries, served with rice.
ingredients: 1 lb sirloin steak, cut into strips
steps: Season the beef strips with salt and pepper.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Sear the beef strips until browned, then remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté the onion, bell pepper, and garlic until softened.
Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until slightly softened.
Return the beef to the skillet. Add soy sauce, red wine vinegar, and oyster sauce. Stir well.
Add the french fries and toss to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the fries are heated through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Serve immediately with cooked white rice.
tips: Use a very hot skillet or wok to ensure the beef sears quickly and doesn't stew.
Don't overcook the vegetables; they should still have a bit of crunch.
Serve immediately to keep the french fries crispy.

name: Classic Margarita Pizza
description: Classic Margarita Pizza is a simple Neapolitan pizza, made with San Marzano tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, salt, and extra-virgin olive oil.
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
steps: Make the dough: In a large bowl, dissolve sugar and yeast in warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy. Add flour, salt, and olive oil. Mix until a dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.

Preheat oven and prepare toppings: Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C). Punch down dough and divide in half. Roll out one portion of dough into a 12-inch circle. Place on a baking sheet or pizza stone. Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Arrange mozzarella slices over the sauce. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Bake: Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with fresh basil leaves after baking. Slice and serve immediately.

name: Beef Salpicao
description: Beef Salpicao is a Filipino dish of diced beef sautéed in garlic, olive oil, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce, and often served with toasted garlic bits and rice.
ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin or tenderloin, cut into 1-inch cubes
steps: Marinate the beef: In a bowl, combine beef cubes, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, black pepper, and salt. Marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Sauté garlic: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden, be careful not to burn.
Cook beef: Add marinated beef to the skillet and cook, stirring frequently, until browned on all sides and cooked to your desired doneness, about 5-7 minutes for medium-rare to medium.
Serve: Transfer beef salpicao to a serving dish. Garnish generously with toasted garlic bits and green onions (if using). Serve immediately with hot cooked rice.

name: Chicken Afritada
description: Chicken Afritada is a Filipino chicken stew braised in tomato sauce with vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers.
ingredients: 1.5 pounds chicken pieces (thighs, drumsticks, or a mix)
1 red bell pepper, cut into strips
1 green bell pepper, cut into strips
steps: Sauté aromatics and chicken: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
Add sauce and braise: Pour in tomato sauce and chicken broth. Add bay leaf, salt, and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.

Add vegetables: Add potatoes and carrots. Continue to simmer, covered, for another 15 minutes, or until potatoes and carrots are almost tender. Add bell peppers and frozen peas. Cook for another 5 minutes, or until bell peppers are tender-crisp and peas are heated through.
Season and serve: Taste and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and fish sauce (if using). Simmer uncovered for a few minutes to thicken the sauce if desired. Serve hot with rice.
